tit.e: Uprising of the Hayato People (an ancient tribe in Kyushu)
Uprising of the Hayato People (an ancient tribe in Kyushu)
Uprising of the Hayato People (an ancient tribe in Kyushu)

sen.j: 隼人の反乱（はやとのはんらん）は、720年（養老4年）九州南部に住む隼人がヤマト王権に対して起こした反乱である。
sen.e: Uprising of the Hayato people was organized by the Hayato in southern Kyushu in 720 to rebel against the Yamato sovereignty.
Uprising of the Hayato people was organized by the Hayato in southern Kyushu in 720 to rebel against the Yamato sovereignty.
Uprising of the Hayato people was organized by the Hayato in southern Kyushu in 720 to rebel against the Yamato sovereignty.

sen.j: 1年半近くに及ぶ戦いは隼人側の敗北で終結し、ヤマト王権の九州南部における支配が確立した。
sen.e: The war which lasted nearly one and a half year ended with the defeat of the Hayato which ensured the rule of Yamato sovereignty in southern Kyushu.
The war that lasted nearly one and a half year ended with the defeat of the Hayato, which ensured the rule of Yamato sovereignty in southern Kyushu.
sen.cmt: "which"は前の文全体を先行詞とする非制限用法で、直前にコンマが必要です。
sen.e: The war that lasted nearly one and a half year ended with the defeat of the Hayato, which ensured the rule of Yamato sovereignty in southern Kyushu.

sen.j: 背景
sen.e: Background
Background
Background

sen.j: 7世紀後半の九州南部はヤマト王権（朝廷）の勢力が及んでいたものの支配体制は完全ではなく、熊襲あるいは隼人と呼ばれる住民が多くの集団に分かれて割拠する状況であった。
sen.e: By the latter half of the seventh century, the power of Yamato sovereignty (Imperial court) had reached southern Kyushu but the ruling system was not yet perfected so that many groups of residents, called Kumaso (a tribe living in the ancient Kyushu district) and Hayato, defended their own local authority.

By the latter half of the seventh century, the power of Yamato sovereignty (Imperial court) had reached southern Kyushu but the ruling system was not yet perfected so that many groups of residents, called Kumaso or Hayato, defended their own local authority.
sen.cmt: 熊襲は隼人と同じく九州の部族であることが文中から明らかなので、（）内の説明は不要だと思います。
sen.e: By the latter half of the seventh century, the power of Yamato sovereignty (Imperial court) had reached southern Kyushu but the ruling system was not yet perfected so that many groups of residents, called Kumaso or Hayato, defended their own local authority.

sen.j: 朝廷は自らの勢力範囲に広く律令制を導入することを試みていたが九州南部においては住民の支持を得られなかった。
sen.e: The Imperial court had attempted to introduce the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) across its sphere of influence but had not been successful in winning the approval by the people of southern Kyushu.

The Imperial court had attempted to introduce the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) across its sphere of influence but had not been successful in winning the approval by the people of southern Kyushu.

The Imperial court had attempted to introduce the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) across its sphere of influence but had not been successful in winning the approval by the people of southern Kyushu.

sen.j: これは律令制が稲作を制度の中心に据えており、稲作に適さないシラス (地質)の広がる九州南部には適合しなかったためである。
sen.e: This was because southern Kyushu was a vast stretch of volcanic ash and sand (geology) inappropriate for rice cropping while the ritsuryo system was centered on rice cropping.
This was because southern Kyushu was a vast stretch of volcanic ash and sand inappropriate for rice cropping while the ritsuryo system was centered on rice cropping.
sen.cmt: 「(地質)」は、魚のシラス等と区別するためだと思われます。英訳には必要ないと思います。
sen.e: This was because southern Kyushu was a vast stretch of volcanic ash and sand inappropriate for rice cropping while the ritsuryo system was centered on rice cropping.

sen.j: 一方、南西諸島を経由した中国大陸との交流が活発化しており、朝廷は覓国使（べっこくし、くにまぎのつかい）と呼ばれる調査隊を組織して九州南部と南西諸島の調査を行っていたが、700年（文武天皇4年）に覓国使が九州南部各地で現地住民から威嚇を受ける事件が発生した。
sen.e: On the other hand, the interaction with Chinese continent via Southwest Islands was accelerated and the Imperial court organized an investigative team called Bekkokushi (a group of researchers sent to Kyushu and Northern islands in Japan during the Nara period) to conduct research on the southern Kyushu and Southwest Islands but, in 700, Bekkokushi encountered threatening attacks by indigenous people in various places of southern Kyushu.

On the other hand, trade with Chinese continent via Southwest Islands was increasing, and the Imperial court organized an investigative team called Bekkokushi or Kunimagi no Tsukai to conduct research on the southern Kyushu and Southwest Islands but, in 700, Bekkokushi encountered threatening attacks by indigenous people in various places of southern Kyushu.
sen.cmt: "interaction"→ここでは"trade"の方が良いと思います。「覓国使」→両方の読みを記載した方が良いと思います。また、この語の意味は文中で説明しているので、（）内の説明を加える必要はないと思います。
sen.e: On the other hand, trade with Chinese continent via Southwest Islands was increasing, and the Imperial court organized an investigative team called Bekkokushi or Kunimagi no Tsukai to conduct research on the southern Kyushu and Southwest Islands but, in 700, Bekkokushi encountered threatening attacks by indigenous people in various places of southern Kyushu.

sen.j: 朝廷は大宰府に武器を集め702年（大宝 (日本)2年）8月、九州南部に兵を送るとともに唱更国（後の薩摩国）を設置し現地の支配体制を強化した。
sen.e: In August 702, the Imperial court assembled weapons in Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region) and sent troops to southern Kyushu at the same time as it established Hayahito Province (later Satsuma Province) for the purpose of reinforcing the ruling system in the area.

In September 702, the Imperial court assembled weapons in Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region) and sent troops to southern Kyushu at the same time as it established Hayahito Province (later Satsuma Province) for the purpose of reinforcing the ruling system in the area.
sen.cmt: 大宝 (日本)2年8月→新暦では702年9月です。
sen.e: In September 702, the Imperial court assembled weapons in Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region) and sent troops to southern Kyushu at the same time as it established Hayahito Province (later Satsuma Province) for the purpose of reinforcing the ruling system in the area.

sen.j: 713年（和銅6年）には大隅国が設置され当時律令制導入の先進地であった豊前国から5000人を移住させ指導に当たらせるなど支配体制がさらに強化されている。
sen.e: Upon the establishment of Osumi Province in 713, 5,000 people were immigrated from Buzen Province, which was advanced in terms of introducing the ritsuryo system, to provide guidance to father reinforce the ruling system.

Upon the establishment of Osumi Province in 713, 5,000 people were immigrated from Buzen Province, where the ritsuryo system was well adopted, to instruct the people there and further reinforce the ruling system.
sen.cmt: 「律令制導入の先進地であった」部分、表現に違和感があるので修正しました。"father"は"further"のスペルミス。
sen.e: Upon the establishment of Osumi Province in 713, 5,000 people were immigrated from Buzen Province, where the ritsuryo system was well adopted, to instruct the people there and further reinforce the ruling system.

sen.j: 律令制、特に班田収授法を推し進めようとする朝廷と、九州南部において共同体的な土地利用形態を守ってきた隼人との間で緊張が高まった。
sen.e: The tension intensified between the Imperial court who tried to promote the ritsuryo system, especially the law of rice field allotment system and the Hayato who kept communal way of land use in southern Kyushu.

The tension intensified between the Imperial court who tried to promote the ritsuryo system, especially the law of rice field allotment system and the Hayato who kept communal way of land use in southern Kyushu.

The tension intensified between the Imperial court who tried to promote the ritsuryo system, especially the law of rice field allotment system and the Hayato who kept communal way of land use in southern Kyushu.

sen.j: 反乱
sen.e: Uprising
sen.cmt: 最初のタイトルでuprisingを使っているので、ここでもuprisingにしました。
sen.e: Uprising
Uprising

sen.j: 720年（養老4年）2月29日、大宰府から朝廷へ「大隅国国司の陽侯史麻呂が殺害された」との報告が伝えられた。
sen.e: In February 29, 720, Dazai-fu reported to the Imperial court that 'YAKO no Fuhitomaro, the provincial governor of Osumi Province was murdered'.
On April 15, 720, Dazai-fu reported to the Imperial court that 'YAKO no Fuhitomaro, the provincial governor of Osumi Province had been murdered'.
sen.cmt: （養老4年）2月29日→新暦では720年4月15日。"was murdered"→"had been murdered"に修正しました。
sen.e: On April 15, 720, Dazai-fu reported to the Imperial court that 'YAKO no Fuhitomaro, the provincial governor of Osumi Province had been murdered'.

sen.j: 朝廷は3月4日、大伴旅人を征隼人持節大将軍に、笠御室と巨勢真人を副将軍に任命し隼人の征討にあたらせた。
sen.e: On 4 March, the Imperial court appointed OTOMO no Tabito as the great general to subdue the Hayato and Kasa no MIMURO and Kose no MAHITO as the vice generals and commanded them to subjugate the Hayato.

On March 4, the Imperial court appointed OTOMO no Tabito as the great general to subdue the Hayato and KASA no Mimuro and KOSE no Mahito as the vice generals and commanded them to subjugate the Hayato.
sen.cmt: 3月4日→新暦では4月19日。「笠御室と巨勢真人」→大文字・小文字の修正しました。
sen.e: On March 4, the Imperial court appointed OTOMO no Tabito as the great general to subdue the Hayato and KASA no Mimuro and KOSE no Mahito as the vice generals and commanded them to subjugate the Hayato.

sen.j: 隼人側は数千人の兵が集まり7ヶ所の城に立て籠もった。
sen.e: Several thousand soldiers of Hayato barricaded themselves in castles in seven places.
Several thousand soldiers of Hayato barricaded themselves in castles in seven places.
Several thousand soldiers of Hayato barricaded themselves in castles in seven places.

sen.j: これに対して朝廷側は九州各地から1万人以上の兵を集め九州の東側および西側からの二手に分かれて進軍し、6月17日には5ヶ所の城を陥落させたと報告している。
sen.e: The Imperial court camp gathered more than 10,000 soldiers from all over Kyushu, split them into two groups to advance from both east and west, and took control of castles in five places out of the seven by 17 June.

The Imperial court gathered more than 10,000 soldiers from all over Kyushu, split them into two groups to advance from both east and west, and took control of castles in five places out of seven by July 30.
sen.cmt: "camp"は不要だとおもいます。6月17日→新暦では7月30日。
sen.e: The Imperial court gathered more than 10,000 soldiers from all over Kyushu, split them into two groups to advance from both east and west, and took control of castles in five places out of seven by July 30.

sen.j: しかしながら残る曽於乃石城（そおのいわき）と比売之城（ひめのき）の2城の攻略に手間取り長期戦となった。
sen.e: But the war prolonged because the remaining castles in Sonoiwaki and Himenoki were tough to conquer.
But the war was prolonged because the remaining castles in Soonoiwaki and Himenoki were tough to conquer.
sen.cmt: "prolonged"→"was prolonged"に修正。「曽於乃石城」→「そおの」は長音を含む「そうの」ではないので、"Soono"とした方が良いと思います。また、「石城」を「いしき」とする本もあります。（http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=sE_ihqC_45QC&pg=PA109&dq=%E2%80%9D%E6%AF%94%E5%A3%B2%E5%9F%8E%E2%80%9D&hl=ja&ei=mdmETM2oO4iivQPEoJH9BA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CC4Q6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=%E2%80%9D%E6%AF%94%E5%A3%B2%E5%9F%8E%E2%80%9D&f=false）
sen.e: But the war was prolonged because the remaining castles in Soonoiwaki and Himenoki were tough to conquer.

sen.j: 大伴旅人は戦列を離れ8月12日に都に戻りその後の攻略を副将軍らに任せている。
sen.e: OTOMO no Tabito stepped off the line of battle and returned to the capital on 12 August, leaving the capturing task to the vice generals.
OTOMO no Tabito left the battlefield and returned to the capital on September 22, leaving the capturing task to the vice generals.
sen.cmt: "stepped off the line"という表現に違和感があるので修正しました。8月12日→新暦では9月22日。
sen.e: OTOMO no Tabito left the battlefield and returned to the capital on September 22, leaving the capturing task to the vice generals.

sen.j: 1年半近くにわたった戦いは隼人側の敗北で終結し、721年（養老5年）7月7日、副将軍らは隼人の捕虜を連れて都に戻った。
sen.e: The one-and-a-half-year war ended with the defeat of the Hayato and the vice generals brought Hayato, the captives, back to the capital on 7 July, 721.
The war that lasted for one and a half years ended with the defeat of the Hayato and the vice generals brought the captives of Hayato back to the capital on August 8, 721.
sen.cmt: 「一年近くにわたった」を簡潔に修正。「隼人の捕虜」を修正。養老5年7月7日→新暦だと721年8月8日。
sen.e: The war that lasted for one and a half years ended with the defeat of the Hayato and the vice generals brought the captives of Hayato back to the capital on August 8, 721.

sen.j: 隼人側の戦死者と捕虜は合わせて1400人であったと伝えられている。
sen.e: The war dead and captives of Hayato totaled 1,400 reportedly.
The war dead and captives of Hayato totaled 1,400 reportedly.
The war dead and captives of Hayato totaled 1,400 reportedly.

sen.j: 反乱のため班田収授法の適用は延期されることになり戦乱から80年近く経過した800年（延暦19年）になってようやく適用されている。
sen.e: Due to the uprising, the application of the law of rice field allotment system was postponed until 800, almost 80 years after the end of the war.
Due to the uprising, the application of the law of rice field allotment system was postponed until 800, almost 80 years after the end of the war.
Due to the uprising, the application of the law of rice field allotment system was postponed until 800, almost 80 years after the end of the war.

sen.j: 関連遺跡
sen.e: Related remains
Related Ruins
Related Ruins

sen.j: 隼人七城
sen.e: Hayato Castles in Seven Places
Hayato Castles in Seven Places
Hayato Castles in Seven Places

sen.j: 隼人側が立て籠もった7ヶ所の城は『八幡宇佐宮御託宣集』によると、奴久等、幸原、神野、牛屎、志加牟、曽於乃石城、比売之城であったとされている。
sen.e: According to "Compendium of Usa Hachiman Oracles", the castles in which the soldiers of Hayato barricaded themselves were situated in the following seven places; Nukura, Sachihara, Kauya, Ushikuso, Shikamu, Sonoiwaki and Himenoki.

According to "Compendium of Usa Hachiman Oracles," the castles in which the soldiers of Hayato barricaded themselves were situated in the following seven places; Nukura, Yukibaru, Kanno, Ushikuso, Shikamu, Soonoiwaki and Himenoki.
sen.cmt: 幸原、神野→「ゆきばる、かんの」小川進一著「宇佐神宮と大神氏」参照（http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=sE_ihqC_45QC&pg=PA109&dq=%22%E5%A5%B4%E4%B9%85%E7%AD%89%22%E3%80%80&hl=ja&ei=fdKETInhDoLKvQOy97yeBA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=2&ved=0CDQQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=%22%E5%A5%B4%E4%B9%85%E7%AD%89%22%E3%80%80&f=false）訳文の通り、「さちはら、かうや」とする個人のHPもあります。（http://otd3.jbbs.livedoor.jp/246945/bbs_plain?base=610&range=1）
sen.e: According to "Compendium of Usa Hachiman Oracles," the castles in which the soldiers of Hayato barricaded themselves were situated in the following seven places; Nukura, Yukibaru, Kanno, Ushikuso, Shikamu, Soonoiwaki and Himenoki.

sen.j: このうち曽於乃石城は国分城 (大隅国)と清水城、比売之城は姫木城と橘木城であったと考えられているが、他の5城については国分平野付近に集中していたとする説と九州南部に広く分散していたとする説がある。
sen.e: It is presumed that Sonoiwaki contained Kokubu-jo Castle (Osumi-jo Castle) and Shimizu-jo Castle and Himenoki contained Himenoki castle and Tachibanaki Castle while the identification of castles in other five places are split between the theory which claims that the castles concentrated near Kokubu plain and the theory which claims that the castles were widely dispersed in southern Kyushu.

It is presumed that Soonoiwaki meant Kokubu-jo Castle (Osumi Province) and Shimizu-jo Castle and Himenoki meant Himeki-jo Castle and Tachibanaki-jo Castle, while there are conflicting theories concerning other five castles: one claiming that the castles were concentrated near the Kokubu Plain and the other claiming that they were widely dispersed in southern Kyushu.
sen.cmt: 曽於乃石城→「いしき」と読む本もあります（上記参照）。"Osumi-jo Castle"→"Osumi Province"に修正。姫木城→「ひめきじょう」"Tachibanaki Castle"→"Tachibanaki-jo Castle"に修正。後半、"identification"が"split"されるという表現に違和感があるので修正しました。「平野」には通常定冠詞をつけます。
sen.e: It is presumed that Soonoiwaki meant Kokubu-jo Castle (Osumi Province) and Shimizu-jo Castle and Himenoki meant Himeki-jo Castle and Tachibanaki-jo Castle, while there are conflicting theories concerning other five castles: one claiming that the castles were concentrated near the Kokubu Plain and the other claiming that they were widely dispersed in southern Kyushu.

sen.j: 隼人塚、凶首塚
sen.e: Hayato burial mound, Kyoshu burial mound
Hayato-zaka Burial Mound and Kyoshu-zuka Burial Mound
sen.cmt: 翻訳仕様指示書に従って、"-zuka Burial Mound"という表現に修正しました。
sen.e: Hayato-zaka Burial Mound and Kyoshu-zuka Burial Mound

sen.j: 戦死者の霊を弔うため戦場近くに隼人塚、朝廷側の拠点であった豊前国には凶首塚（現在の宇佐市百体神社）が建てられた。
sen.e: Hayato burial mound was built near the battlefield and Kyoshu burial mound (present Hyakutai Shrine in Usa City) was built in Buzen Province where the headquarter of the Imperial court was located, in order to mourn for the war dead.

Hayato-zuka burial mound was built near the battlefield and Kyoshu-zuka burial mound (present Hyakutai-jinja Shrine in Usa City) was built in Buzen Province where the base of the Imperial court was located, in order to mourn for the war dead.
sen.cmt: 翻訳仕様指示書に従って、"-zuka burial mound"という表現に修正しました。同様に、百体神社の訳も修正しました。"headquarter"より"base"の方が良いと思います。
sen.e: Hayato-zuka burial mound was built near the battlefield and Kyoshu-zuka burial mound (present Hyakutai-jinja Shrine in Usa City) was built in Buzen Province where the base of the Imperial court was located, in order to mourn for the war dead.

sen.j: 亀ノ甲遺跡
sen.e: Kamenoko Ruins
Kamenoko Ruins
Kamenoko Ruins

sen.j: 1953年（昭和28年）12月、霧島市の向花小学校拡張工事中に刀剣や土器などが発見され、隼人の反乱で殺害された国司の墓所ではないかと考えられている。
sen.e: The premise of the Muke Elementary School in Kirishima City is thought to have been the graveyard of the provincial governor who was killed during the uprising of the Hayato people since swords and earthenware were found during the school's expansion work in 1953.

The premises of the Muke Elementary School in Kirishima City is thought to have been the graveyard of the provincial governor who was killed during the uprising of the Hayato people since swords and earthenware were found during the school's expansion work in December 1953.
sen.cmt: "premise"は「敷地」の意味では複数形。「12月」→訳抜けです。
sen.e: The premises of the Muke Elementary School in Kirishima City is thought to have been the graveyard of the provincial governor who was killed during the uprising of the Hayato people since swords and earthenware were found during the school's expansion work in December 1953.
